snippet: At 63, Sam Romero has never felt more wanted.    Mr. Romero, the son of Mexican immigrants, is a retired cabinetmaker, a Reagan Democrat and a veteran. In other words, he is the kind of blue-collar voter that Representative Loretta Sanchez and her...
lead_paragraph: At 63, Sam Romero has never felt more wanted. Mr. Romero, the son of Mexican immigrants, is a retired cabinetmaker, a Reagan Democrat and a veteran. In other words, he is the kind of blue-collar voter that Representative Loretta Sanchez and her Republican challenger, Robert K. Dornan, the former incumbent, are courting like lovesick teen-agers.
abstract: Focus on tightening election rematch in California's 46th Congressional District between incumbent Democratic Repr Loretta Sanchez and former Repr Robert K Dornan; Sanchez is favored to win in heavily Hispanic and Asian district, even though 35 percent of voters, most Republicans, remain undecided; photos; map (M)

headline.main: Bitter Rematch Reflects Changes in Orange County
